text: Peter Kenneth Dews (born 22 April 1952) is a British philosopher, in the fields of critical theory and continental philosophy. He made his name with the Logics of Disintegration, on the limitations of post-structuralism. He is Professor of Philosophy at the University of Essex. His first degree was in English, at Queens' College, Cambridge. He has a doctorate in philosophy from the University of Southampton. Dews is known for his work on the New Left, called 'The New Philosophers and the End of Leftism'. == Work == * Logics of Disintegration: Post-Structuralist Thought and the Claims of Critical Theory (1987) * The Limits of Disenchantment: Essays on Contemporary European Philosophy (1995) * Deconstructive Subjectivities (Ed.)
